actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Judiciary.

official_title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress that no action should be taken on the part of the Federal Government, any State or political subdivision thereof that would remove the song "Dixie" from its proper place in the history of the United States and that region of the United States known as the South, or prohibit same from being played as a part of any public function or gathering.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of Congress that no action should be taken on the part of the Federal Government, any State or political subdivision thereof that would remove the song "Dixie" from its proper place in the history of the United States and that region of the United States known as the South, or prohibit the song from being played as a part of any public function or gathering.

titles.title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress that no action should be taken on the part of the Federal Government, any State or political subdivision thereof that would remove the song "Dixie" from its proper place in the history of the United States and that region of the United States known as the South, or prohibit same from being played as a part of any public function or gathering.
